title: 114_s278
content: The "Citizen Empowerment Act" is a new law that adds a chapter on services to members of the public in the United States Code. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" outlines procedures for in-person and telephonic interactions conducted by executive branch employees, defining terms like 'covered interaction' and 'telephonic'. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" allows individuals to record audio of interactions with executive branch employees at their own expense. Employees conducting interactions can also record with prior notice to the individual and provide a transcript upon request. Employees of Executive agencies must inform individuals before recording interactions and provide a transcript upon request, with reimbursement for transcription costs. Additionally, employees must explain individuals' rights before or at the start of interactions, with separate notifications for different violations. Employees of Executive agencies must provide separate notifications for different violations.
